attributes.action: Ban the use of loud fireworks in residential areas
attributes.background: Many animals find fireworks scary. It is estimated that 45 per cent of dogs and other animals in the UK show signs of fear when they hear fireworks (RSPCA). This can include toileting indoors, shaking, barking and crying. Fireworks should not be used in a residential area to avoid animal distress.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks should not be allowed in residential areas, and should only be allowed in a licensed settings on set days, not days or weeks before/after the event.

attributes.action: 1p and 2p coins should be removed from circulation (cash transactions only)
attributes.background:
We the undersigned want to see the 1p and 2p pieces removed from circulation, since they are no longer of a useful value.

Over time, due to inflation, the value of a coin decreases. The one and two penny pieces are now worth so little that we cannot buy anything useful with them.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important to clarify that this petition is not asking for ALL transactions to be rounded to the nearest 5p. This petition only applies to cash. It calls for removal of 1p and 2p coins, therefore any cash transaction would result in change given rounded to the nearest 5p.

Examples
- If I were to use cash to buy a bottle of milk costing 99p, I would receive no change, since 1p rounds down to zero.

- If I were to buy a cake costing 96p, I would receive 5p change, because 4p rounds up to 5p.

attributes.action: Stop advancement of religion being considered a charitable purpose.
attributes.background: The law recognises the advancement of religion as a charitable purpose. Religion includes all faiths and none  it includes a religion that does not have a belief in God. Advancing any belief system alone should not be considered charitable activity.
attributes.additional_details: Some belief systems may help people but assessing whether the beliefs themselves achieve benefit is subjective.  Public money through gift aid should not be available for this. Religious organisations should have to show other public benefit to qualify as charity and should only be allowed to use public money for that other purpose.

attributes.action: Bring back the paper tax disc.
attributes.background: Bring back the paper tax disc, as you can view the tax disc on your screen and can be seen, that you have a tax disc and have the tax, as people are not paying the tax, as well all the tax should go towards the up keep of the road only and not to be used with other tax.
attributes.additional_details: The DVLA hasn't done enough to tell people when they need to pay. When your tax is due, you get a reminder letter, but this is not enough for thousands of people, who forget their renewal date, and can face a fine of up to £1,000.

attributes.action: Remove reassessments for PIP for those already receiving Disability Allowance.
attributes.background: The government have decided to end Disability Living Allowance (DLA) for all people aged between 16 and 64 and asked them to apply for PIP (Personal Independence Payment). It is also asking over 70% of applicants to go through a reassessment, despite previous assessments being carried out by DWP
attributes.additional_details: This petition is in place to ask the government to only apply new rules and assessments to new applicants for PIP rather than put people who already suffer with disabilities - both physical and mental - through the traumatic experience of reapplying and reassessment when this was done by the DWP when applying for Disability Allowance. There is no need to inflict this on the disabled community and the government should look elsewhere to save money, not to those who are already suffering enough!

attributes.background: Following the "anti-gay propaganda" bill signed into law by President Vladimir Putin on 30 June 2013 and the resulting continued and ongoing oppression, imprisonment and torture of members of the Russian LGBT community. May the UK government offer automatic asylum and support to whoever may seek it.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_gay_propaganda_law

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4397118/Chechnya-opens-concentration-camp-homosexuals.html

attributes.action: Change the law to make any MP who changes allegiance from one party to resign
attributes.background: Any MP or councillor can charge party allegiance with no thought to the electors who voted for them when they stood for a particular party, when chaging party they no longer represent the thoughts of those who elected them.  They should be made to resign and face a new election.

attributes.action: Air-drop Reactive Skin Decontamination Lotion (RSDL) to Idlib, Syria.
attributes.background: With the use of drones, immediate assistance can be provided by dropping these RSDL kits to civilians and hospitals in and around the Khan Sheikhoun area as continued strikes against their facilities has made treating patients incredibly difficult.
attributes.additional_details:
Sarin gas has the potential to end a life within ten minutes of exposure. This is because once this chemical finds its way into the body it manipulates neurotransmission activity by making the body act against itself. This may lead to convulsions, paralysis, and death. Some of it indicators are pupil constriction, blurry vision, and chest tightening. This lotion specifically counteracts the effects of chemical warfare by blocking the skin from absorbing deadly chemicals.  

Taking immediate and effective action now and distributing these kits across this region and other conflict zones in Syria may then disincentivise the carrying out of chemical attacks again.

attributes.action: Make it law for every public area to have a disabled toilet and baby change area
attributes.background: Today I had to change my 7 month old daughter on a toilet side. This is not the first time. How disgusting in 2017. A baby change area is less than £100. In the "family" resteraunt I was in there was also no disabled toilet. Every public area needs to be accommodating to disabled and baby change.

attributes.action: Stop paying child benefit/ tax credit to children NOT living in the UK.
attributes.background:
A Conservative Party pledge to stop British taxpayers’ money being sent to the families of EU migrants across the continent looks like it will be broken.

The Times report that EU migrants will still be able to receive child benefits even for families who have never even set foot in Britain .
attributes.additional_details: http://www.westmonster.com/tories-to-break-promise-on-benefits-for-eu-migrants/

attributes.action: Allow blood transfusion recipients to donate blood and bone marrow
attributes.background: Currently, those who have received a blood transfusion since January 1980 are not permitted to donate blood or bone marrow, due to fears of vCJD transmission.
attributes.additional_details: At the time of the ban, 1 transfusion recipient was suspected, not proved,  of developing vCJD due to donor blood contamination. An estimated 52,000 people were prevented from donating by the ban. At a time when blood and bone marrow donors are dangerously low, it is patently ridiculous to deny life-saving supplies based on the tiny chance of recipients developing CJD decades later. Either the ban should be lifted, or at risk donors should  assessed on a case by case basis.

attributes.action: Regulate amateur performance requirements.
attributes.background: Many councils do not know what exactly is required in regards to the documentation to put on an amateur performance. These amateur performers do not get paid. We want the law simplified for Amateur performers to be able to perform for their families without all the ever changing regulations.
attributes.additional_details: As qualified and experienced dance teachers we understand the importance of keeping our students safe but in many cases what is now required of a dance/performing arts school is excessive. We currently have 2540 signatures on our change.org petition. The law needs to be changed before we all stop putting on performances which will have an effect on local theatres and our businesses. Help us small business owners to put our students on stage and regulate the requirements across the country.

attributes.action: Stop Corby Urgent Care Centre (8-8) Closure
attributes.background:
Corby Urgent Care Centre (8-8) is said to be closing.

This will cause disruption not to only the community but other health services also! 

Please sign!  DON'T CLOSE OUR 8-8 service!

attributes.action: Allow orphans to inherit from parents without being subject to inheritance tax.
attributes.background: Currently if you are a single parent and die leaving minor kids, they can only inherit up to £325,000 and anything more than that is taxed at 40%.  In contrast, anything that you leave to a spouse/civil partner is inherited tax free, even if s/he is earning well and/or has sufficient own resources.
attributes.additional_details: It seems fundamentally wrong that helpless, resourceless orphans are treated less well than bereaved spouses/partners.  It is not the mark of a civilized society that the inheritance of a vulnerable, hapless orphan should be raided for tax.  Such a situation also leads dying single parents to enter into contrived marriages or other schemes just to shelter the assets of the estate; and sometimes that situation can go drastically wrong.  Surely the UKs orphans ought to be treated better!

attributes.action: Build a new Royal Yacht Britannia
attributes.background:
Following the EU referendum, we should build a new Royal Yacht Britannia using British Steel, British Workers and training British apprentices.

Britannia would be a Flag Ship for a newly invigorated Britain sailing the oceans of the world promoting the UK globally as a free trading nation.
attributes.additional_details: This is a perfect opportunity to invest British money in a project that will create British jobs, train British apprentices and produce a fully British product. The Royal family will once again be able to showcase British engineering and design at its best whilst visiting countries all over the world establishing and building relationships that will pave the way for trade deals with our Global partners.

attributes.action: Make Companies Responsible For Travel Costs After Public Transport Has Stopped.
attributes.background: Members of staff in many companies and businesses spend a large amount of their wages on travel home after hours, businesses and companies should take responsibilty for travel costs for their employees after hours (and on bank holiday's, opens, weekends etc.)
attributes.additional_details: Companies and businesses do not take into consideration the struggle of students, open/close staff, members of staff who live a far distance from work etc. And should been forced to pay travel costs.

attributes.action: Stop mothers trying to stop fathers from seeing their kids
attributes.background: We request the Government to amend the Children Act 1989 and bring in the Presumption of Shared Residence as was originally recommended and intended for the Children Act 1989

attributes.action: Allow Liverpool/Merseyside to have a referendum on independence.
attributes.background: Liverpool and its people have always felt disconnected from the rest of the country especially the south, I would like the government to look into the possibility of giving us a independence referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Many people in Liverpool feel apart from the rest of the country, this is well known.

attributes.action: Create a federal United Kingdom, giving more powers to devolved administrations.
attributes.background: The way forward for the United Kingdom is to change the way we do our politics. With the UK government and Scottish government at an impass, along with Wales and regions around England calling for greater autonomy, the reasonable solution would be to create a federalised United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland backed remaining in the UK by 45%, yet voted to leave the EU by 62%.
The Welsh government are looking for assurances after Brexit.

The way to solve this is to create an English parliament and devolve powers from Westminster to England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

Each government is given a greater role in overseeing their nation/region's success.

The UK government would provide responsibility in the fields of defence, the overall economy, immigration and so on.

attributes.action: Make maternity pay your full pay for the entirety of your maternity leave.
attributes.background: I am on maternity leave at the moment and I know a lot of other people are too. We are all really struggling to make ends meet with the statutory maternity pay. We have all applied for the benefits we are entitled to, we either get rejected or its just not enough and we are all struggling.

attributes.action: Bring the National Insurance system in-line with that of Income Tax
attributes.background: The weekly amount of pay after which all employees have to start paying National Insurance contributions has not been increased in line with the 'headline-grabbing' increases to the Personal Allowance for Income tax and represents a major penalty to business, especially those who employ themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
The 'Primary Earnings Threshold' (weekly earnings) for commencement of National Insurance contributions has increased by an amount of just £16 since 2011/12; an increase of just over 10%. https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/516787/Table-a4.pdf 
The Personal Allowance for Income Tax from over the same time to 2017/18, by contrast, represents an increase of over 50%.
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/516769/Table-a1.pdf

attributes.action: Reverse share dividend tax hike.
attributes.background: How can the conservative Government make tax breaks on shares look very attractive, encouraging the public buy them in April 2016. Then change the rules after the share prices have plunged due to Brexit. #very wrong

attributes.action: HMO to be soundproofed.
attributes.background: Our lives are a living hell because of HMO property next door ,Legislation is required so families like ours can live in peace .
attributes.additional_details: We have endured countless sleepless nights due to the property next door whilst we have nothing against students we now feel our lives are a living hell .this affected our health and well being ,having brought up our family here it is heartbreaking that we are going to have to sell as we can not live like this any longer ,the landlords need to be accountable and responsible for their property,allowing  neighbours to live in peace.

attributes.action: Stop the Closure of West Cumberland Hospital
attributes.background: The closure of West Cumberland Hospital in Whitehaven is imminent. The maternity unit & others are affected. It is 30 miles to Barrow & 40 miles to Carlisle Hospital. It has been reported that patients have died in transit to either hospital. How can the NHS justify this.
attributes.additional_details: They have built a new hospital at the rear of the old West Cumberland Hospital but are now closing certain sections down. The new MP for Copeland needs to fight this closer & back the people of Whitehaven. I urge you to sign the petition & stop the closure of the only hospital within a 30 miles radius.

attributes.action: Make it law for school to start at 10am and finish later.
attributes.background: There have been many studies that suggest school starts too early for teenagers brains to function properly. If we started later not as many people would be late and would increase productivity.
attributes.additional_details: Many different studies suggest this.

attributes.action: Increase the funding of the cadet forces of Britain
attributes.background: The cadets are poorly funded and that's not good so more money would be nice so we can all get susats and jetboils

attributes.action: Stop HGV vehicles using the third lane on four lane motorway sections.
attributes.background: Stop sections of motorways slowing to a crawl and causing long tail backs across three lanes.
attributes.additional_details: When HGV  vehicles block three lanes it cause other drivers to drive erratically to get past.

attributes.action: Allow the Church of England to legally perform gay marriages
attributes.background: The Government's Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill was on 17th July 2013. However, The Act does not allow the Church of England to perform same sex marriages. If the church is willing to perform them or not should not matter, the law should not prevent the church from doing them.
attributes.additional_details:
The legislation to create same - sex marriage was explicitly drafted so that no church or church minister can be compelled " by any means " to carry out same - sex wedding. The Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act contains the Government's ' quad lock ', a set of four safeguards for churches and ministers who disagree with same sex marriage. The fourth safeguard states that the Church of England cannot opt in under the terms of the 
2013 Act.

attributes.action: Ban gambling and live odds advertising during sports broadcasts.
attributes.background: With the explosion of the Premier League, a similar and more sinister growth has taken place, that of online gambling. A gambling addiction can ruin families and lives and with smartphones accessible 24/7, it has never been easier to gamble.
attributes.additional_details: The government has banned smoking adverts yet betting companies are still allowed to advertise, with a 600% increase from 2006-2012 and children as young as 4 being exposed to 200 adverts a year. This creates a sense that gambling is part of life and everybody is doing it whereas in reality it can become dangerous. We are not asking for a ban on gambling, all we want is to separate the enjoyment of sport from the dangers of gambling, by banning gambling adverts during the broadcast of sport.

attributes.action: Give early years teachers (with EYTS) the same rights for pay as those with QTS.
attributes.background: EYTs have to pass the same skills test and interviews to qualify onto the course, and meet and pass against the same amount of standards and assessments as those with QTS. Therefore rights for starting pay should be the same, and the professionalism of the early years should be further recognised.
attributes.additional_details: Get into teaching (https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/funding-and-salary/teacher-salaries) states 'As a newly qualified teacher you’ll begin on a salary of at least £22,467, or £28,098 in inner London. As you rise up the pay ranges, you could earn as much as £115,582 as a head...' However on the same web page it states an unqualified teacher can receive a minimum of £16,461. Early Years Teachers are currently viewed as 'unqualified' despite the vigorous post graduate year training.

attributes.action: Don't jail journalists for publishing documents deemed harmful to the economy
attributes.background: Under new proposals for an Espionage Act to replace the Official Secrets Act journalists could be jailed for 14 years for obtaining or publishing anything that could be deemed harmful to our economy. This is against democracy, undermines journalism and its role of checking powers.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/02/11/journalists-obtain-leaked-official-material-could-sent-prison/

attributes.action: Reject the ratification of the Unitary Patent treaty by the UK and Scotland
attributes.background: The Unitary Patent contain articles which refers to the supremacy of the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU), while politicians have promised to respect the democratic Brexit vote of UK citizens to leave the EU; The UPC court will provide case law in favor of software patents.
attributes.additional_details:
For a more complete and lengthy petition, see http://nounitarysoftwarepatents.uk

Please contact your Member of Parliament in the UK and Scotland and ask him/her to sign and endorse this resolution http://www.parliament.uk/edm/2016-17/940

attributes.action: Stop variable speed limits on motorways
attributes.background: The cameras on motorways are just there to raise money not to stop accidents drivers spend more time watching there speed than driving and watching the road
attributes.additional_details: There are over 1000 speed camera fines issued per day bringing in millions for the country but doing nothing for road safety

attributes.action: Review the PIPs scoring system as being Dickensian & unfair in the 21st century.
attributes.background: The current review system is bias & unfair against disabled people who rely highly on access to places that abled people enjoy on a daily basis.
attributes.additional_details: Disabled people are made to feel like criminals during & following the reviews. They're made to apply for this benefit in a totally bias and unfair way on a claim form which asks 10 questions towards daily living but only 2 on mobility, which is the main purpose for disabled people applying for this benefit, in the first place. Maybe, if there must be 12 questions, a balance of 6 for daily living & 6 for mobility would be fairer & maybe provide a better view of a individuals needs?

attributes.action: Ban Employment Agencies
attributes.background:
Employment Agencies exploit workers by acting as middle men to real jobs, they take cuts from already terrible wages, and have ruined chances for secure employment for British Nationals.

This drives down the UK living standards, work life balance, and makes it tougher to get real employment.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies that employ staff also exploit Employment Agencies as they pay agencies less money than they would pay their staff to get work done. Companies don't have to employ agency workers as staff, even when the workers do a fantastic job.

Some agency workers even come from different countries, and are happy to work for pittance as their foreign value of money is less than ours in the UK.

This is extremely unfair and unethical for for British Nationals in their own country.

attributes.action: Allow students undertaking work experience the right to accept/be paid
attributes.background: As of right now students who need to undertake work experience in order to complete their course are unable to accept pay from their work experience. Students have to take a large amount of time off from their usual jobs to complete work experience and most will miss out on a large amount of pay.
attributes.additional_details: Missing work, means missing pay and for some missing pay is the difference between being able to pay rent or not, being able to afford bills or even being able to afford food.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on Trump and his cabinet if they withdraw from or ignore COP21.
attributes.background: Individuals in the current US administration have in the past shown disregard for scientific data on climate change and are signaling they might not follow on US commitments taken at the COP21 agreement. The UK should consider putting such individuals on the list of financial sanctions target.

attributes.action: Divert our "special relationship" from USA to Mexico.
attributes.background: We have a "special relationship" with America. It means nothing at all - there are no favours through that relationship.
attributes.additional_details: It is symbolic and I don’t think we should be symbolically aligning to somewhere run by someone who makes inappropriate remarks about children, who imposes executive orders which may be illegal.

attributes.action: If a person has a multiple birth they should be given more time off work.
attributes.background: Why should you get 1 year off for one baby and the same amount of time for more than one. If someone has multiples it's really hard to bond or even get in a routine.
attributes.additional_details: It's stressful trying to find childcare for more than one baby also while there only 9 month I really believe multiple mums should get more time off work

attributes.action: Allow carers to still get paid when, the person they care for is hospitalised.
attributes.background:
Change the cruel rule, where if the person you care for is hospitalised, you have payment stopped, full time careers still have to pay their bills, & sometimes still have to care for that person whilst in hospital.
Or do you expect them to somehow get a job for the duration of the hospital stay?

attributes.action: To listen to the people and to trigger the article 50 so we can Brexit.
attributes.background: The people of England have spoken we need the article 50 to be triggered. We have voted for this country to be out of the EU.Therefore the government should listen to its people.
attributes.additional_details: We joined the EU for trading only NOT to be under their laws as suggested. We want democracy not to be the EU's puppets.

attributes.action: Urge Broadband Companies to change old aluminium wires to copper for fibre optic
attributes.background: I have an old aluminium line that goes a fair distance which causes a lot of drop off in the connection, as aluminium is a worse conductor in comparison to copper. Households across England get offered broadband packages that connection lines cannot deliver due to old forgotten aluminium cables.
attributes.additional_details: I live in Milton Keynes, in an area called two mile ash where aluminium is used, I am fairly far away from the cabinet I’m connected to which causes me to get a max connection of 10.5Mbps download and 1Mbps upload. Houses further than me experience a worse drop off rate however an area near me called Emerson valley, where they've used copper can reach speeds of 54Mbps download and 13Mbps upload copper makes a big difference and should be the standard for a modern faster England.

attributes.action: Return to the previous method of calculating Child Maintenance Payments.
attributes.background: The new Child Maintenance Service takes an estranged parents income direct from HMRC records.  This means that this now includes "income" listed on the HMRC listing that may be for benefit in kind taxation purposes and not be cash in a parents bank which is grossly unfair.
attributes.additional_details: Rt Hon Damien Green needs to order a review of the changes to return to the old method of calculating CSA payments from net income which is the only disposable income an estranged parent has control over.

attributes.action: Fully fund A&E and urgent care by a specific A&E tax paid by most people.
attributes.background: There is national alarm at the state of many A and E departments with excessive waiting times and some inappropriate use by people who should be treated elsewhere. Separate funding paid for fully by a broad based tax to which most if not all contribute is needed to provide sufficient urgent care.
attributes.additional_details:
Refer to sensible views of Philippa Whitford in the NHS and Social Care funding in the House of Commons on Jan 11th 2017. She presents the impressive model as practised in Scotland.
Everyone knows that A and E is not coping in many parts of the country. This is exacerbated by the lack of GP availability out of hours and at weekends. Demand has risen due to an ageing population and lack of alternative facilities. A and E is one of the few services that virtually everybody will use in their lives.

attributes.action: Nominate Tunstall Tower Square as a UNESCO World Heritage Site
attributes.background: Tunstall Tower Square in Stoke on Trent is an indicative example of Tower squares across the country. In an area of high cultural significance for the country and for the industrial revolution which changed the world forever the Tower Square should be protected.

attributes.action: To make a ban on eating disorder websites or videos as this destroys lives.
attributes.background: This is something that effects me. I think that promoting the way doing eating disorders is disgusting and should be a crime as it affects lives. I have seen all these websites where they tell best was to purge (throwing up food). This is horrible and needs to stop as this is killing people.
attributes.additional_details: The are many horrible web sites like these that need to be banned as they are destroying lives and families. Please help me stop these horrible websites as they are messing peoples lives.

attributes.action: Assure that the Banbury Horton General Hospital stays open as Oxford is too far!
attributes.background: In writing this as a ambulance practitioner I am solely concerned with patients care as for a seriously ill patient or one in cardiac arrest yo be conveyed from Banbury and surrounding area all the way to Oxford would assuredly kill them we must protect Horton Hospital as a local Banbury resource!!!
attributes.additional_details: See NHS statistics and the resuscitation councils standards for early access in cardiac arrest and cardiac event cases and or cva's/stroke victims time every single second counts

attributes.action: A standard internet speed of 24 megabits per second (Mbps) for the UK.
attributes.background: In the 21st Century our lives are dependent on the internet; while in Dorset, Eng we have to depend on 0.64 Mbps download. This is humiliatingly far behind other nations' and insufficient to even stream a film. Therefore, we propose a minimum speed of 24 Mbps that will ensure fair speeds for the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some examples of the poor speeds from across the UK:

http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/38067272/autumn-statement-five-places-you-say-need-better-broadband-around-the-uk

In rural Dorset: http://www.speedtest.net/my-result/5904028990

http://www.techdigest.tv/2016/12/4g-coverage-better-in-peru-than-britain-says-damning-report-from-lord-adonis.html

http://www.telecomstechnews.com/news/2016/dec/20/uk-14-million-premises-lack-decent-broadband-connections-finds-ofcom/

attributes.action: The Government should recognise Taiwan's right for national self determination.
attributes.background: The UK Government should revise its view of the 'One China Policy' to recognize that Taiwan is a beacon of democracy in Asia and that it is for the people of Taiwan to decide their future and not the Chinese Communist Party, which is known to be an authoritarian and oppressive government.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is not about requesting that the UK Government recognises Taiwan as a country but instead that it recognises that it is for the people of Taiwan to determine their future free of threats from the Chinese Government.

The Chinese Government's claim to control the destiny of the people Taiwan is a dangerous and outdated philosophy based on colonialism. This is because although Taiwan was once part of mainland China it has not been for almost a 120 years.

attributes.action: Save cyclists' lives by introducing 'The Dutch Reach' into the Driving Test
attributes.background: To simply and cheaply save cyclists' lives, we need to require a person to use their opposite hand to open a car door if they are to pass a driving test. This turns the body bringing passing cyclists into view.
attributes.additional_details:
This tiny change is called 'The Dutch Reach' as it is used in the Netherlands.  It saves people on bikes from being knocked into traffic when people open car doors. Using the opposite hand to open a car door forces the body to turn, so the driver sees the cyclist and fewer people are injured and killed on the roads. Such as this incident:

http://gu.com/p/5g79g?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other 

Video: see http://www.pri.org/stories/2016-09-27/easy-maneuver-borrowed-dutch-could-be-life-saving-cyclists
